Description: Fragment of wall and lower rim, offset on interior, of Attic red-figured pottery cup; interior: glazed black with traces of dots (berries) in faded added white on rim; faded added white band below offset of rim; exterior: on left, part of large partly enclosed palmette with central leaf breaking the enclosure line; on right, upper part of draped figure facing right (back of head, draped shoulder).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Piekarski places this fragment near the YZ group and gives the following comparanda: ARV2 1522ff; CVA Oxford (2) III I 112 pl. 54, 40; CVA Vienna (1) III I 26f pl. 29ff See especially Vienna 202 (ARV2 1523, 1; Boardman ARFV Classical Period, fig. 425).
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p.43 no. C 25 pl. 17.1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1764)
